text: Berks County is a county located in the U.S. state of Pennsylvania. As of the 2020 census, the population was 428,849. The county seat is Reading. == History == It was named after the English county of Berkshire where William Penn's family had large estates.William Henry Egle, History of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia: E. M. Gardner, 1883), p. 378 Berkshire is often abbreviated as Berks. Reading developed during the 1740s. At that time the people living in northern Lancaster County sent several petitions requesting that a separate county be made. With the help of German immigrant Conrad Weiser, the county was formed on March 11, 1752. It was made from parts of Chester County, Lancaster County, and Philadelphia County. == References == Category:1750s establishments in Pennsylvania Category:1752 establishments Category:Pennsylvania counties
